block.p: Alexandra Lee Ward, the daughter of Virginia Costigan Ward of Columbia, Md., and John Vines Ward of Tokyo, was married yesterday to John Anselm McCarthy, a son of Mavourneen and Colman McCarthy of Washington. The Rev. Winthrop Brainerd, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of the Epiphany in Washington.

Mrs. McCarthy, 27, is a special education teacher at the Kingsbury Day School, a private elementary and middle school in Washington. She graduated from Wittenberg University in Springfield, Ohio, and received a master's degree in special education from American University. Her father, based Tokyo, is the president of Promar Japan, an affiliate of Promar International, a consulting firm specializing in business and marketing strategy for food and agriculture.

Mrs. McCarthy, 27, is a special education teacher at the Kingsbury Day School, a private elementary and middle school in Washington. Her father, based Tokyo, is the president of Promar Japan, an affiliate of Promar International, a consulting firm specializing in business and marketing strategy for food and agriculture.

Mr. McCarthy, 31, is the founder and director of Elementary Baseball, a nonprofit literacy and sports mentoring program in Washington for disadvantaged children, and the founder and director of Home Run Baseball Camp, a summer camp in Washington for boys and girls. He graduated from Troy State University. His father, a former political columnist for The Washington Post, and mother work for the Center for Teaching Peace, an organization in Washington that supplies schools with materials about conflict resolution. The bridegroom's mother is the organization's administrative vice president and his father is its director.
